Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The new Lok Sabha Speaker, Om Birla, a two-time BJP MP from Rajasthan, is a relative newcomer for the post traditionally held by seniors.   A surprise pick by the ruling BJP-led NDA   , Birla's name was proposed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself for the post, sources said. The 56-year-old leader is considered to be close to both Modi and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah. Birla's nomination for the Lok Sabha Speaker's post also has the   backing of non-NDA parties   such as the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) and the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). Starting his political journey as a student leader, Birla was also elected to the Rajasthan Assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. He won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was again elected this year from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. Birla defeated Congress's Ramnarayan Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently-concluded general election. A conscientious parliamentarian, Birla has registered an 86-per cent average attendance in the House, asked 671 questions, participated in 163 debates and introduced six private members' bills in the 16th Lok Sabha. From 1991 to 2003, he was a key leader in the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) as a state-level president first and then, as a vice-president at the national level. Birla, who holds a Masters degree in commerce, is a member of the Standing Committee on Energy in Parliament, the Committee on Petitions and the Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. He succeeds eight-time MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Lok Sabha Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this is not the first time that a relative newcomer has occupied the position. In 1996, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader G M C Balayogi, also a two-time MP then, was elected as the Speaker in the Lower House of Parliament. After his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Rocky Knob: A stepping stone in Kargil v.description: CHANDIGARH: Twenty years ago, on June 17, a risky, daring daytime assault by the Infantry backed by the pulverisation of Pakistan Army bunkers by the Bofors had revived the faltering momentum of the Tololing victory. Having got bogged down for two nights after the Tololing victory on June 13/14, the Indian Army regained the initiative by capturing Rocky Knob and Humps 9 & 10 by 6 pm on June 17. Rocky Knob’s capture went on to serve as the base for the victorious assault three nights later on Point 5140, the highest, dominating feature on the Tololing-Point 5140 ridgeline overlooking the national highway and allowing the enemy’s interdiction of military transport to the Siachen glacier. The battles for Tololing, Tiger Hill, Point 4875 are famous but lesser known are battles such as those for Rocky Knob. But they were vital because they served as stepping stones in the 8 Mountain Division’s strategy to recapture the Drass ridgelines “sequentially”. Flushed with the Tololing success, the Army did not want to lose momentum and allow the enemy to consolidate and counter-attack. After Tololing, the feature Humps, which was extending towards the next major target, Point 5140, was captured by 18 Grenadiers. Then, 13 JAK Rifles was tasked to capture Rocky Knob and Humps 9 &10, which were stepping stones extending further to Point 5140. Panchkula-based Lt Gen Amar Aul, who retired as chief of staff, HQs, Western Command at Chandimandir, was then commanding 56 Mountain Brigade at Drass. “The 13 JAK Rifles got bogged down for two days in trying to capture Rocky Knob via night assaults. I then took a risk with a daytime assault, which is acceptable in an operational environment. The acceptable distance for our troops is 800 m from where the Bofors is going to hit targets. But we moved the troops only 300 m from target zone. Then, we took two Bofors guns to a bridge west of Drass town and next to the ammunition dump. From there, we got a direct line of sight of Rocky Knob. At 3.30 pm, I was there and the Bofors resorted to direct fire mode and lambasted enemy bunkers at Rocky Knob. After that pasting, 13 JAK Rifles (Alpha company under Major S Vijay Bhaskar, Vir Chakra) assaulted Rocky Knob and Humps 9 & 10 and captured them by 6 pm,” Aul told TOI. Bofors fire was devastating for Rocky Knob, says Maj Gen Lakhwinder SinghWithout the accuracy and firepower of the Bofors, the Infantry could never have dreamt of a daytime assault. “The Drass ridges were bare, our Infantry could not approach the enemy lodged at commanding heights without the overwhelming fire support of the artillery. Assaults were at night because of these factors. The Infantry was very brave in taking frontal assaults but without artillery they could not have achieved success at those high altitudes. For the Rocky Knob firing, the Bofors fire was just devastating. Imagine the devastation the enemy faced: 42 kg Bofors shells delivered on enemy bunkers with a muzzle velocity of more than 2,500 feet per second. After the Bofors firing, the Infantry’s 13 JAK Rifles assaulted and took the features without a casualty,” Maj Gen Lakhwinder Singh, who commanded the 8 Mountain Artillery Brigade during the war, told TOI. That lesser-known battle for Rocky Knob would play a vital role three nights later. "Our main target was Point 5140 of which Rocky Knob was a kind of base. The significance of Point 5140 was that it was virtually at the LOC, it commanded observation of Tololing and Bhimbet nallahs, Sando Heights, Drass village etc. The control of Point 5140 by the intrusion of the 6 Northern Light Infantry made our troop movement under its observation very hazardous as it was the highest, dominating feature. So, we achieved victory on Point 5140 by surprise and deception. I launched 18 Garhwal Rifles and 1 Naga from the north and west of Point 5140 by 8.30 pm on June 20. The enemy thought the assault was coming from those directions as our troops had concentrated in strength. However, as the enemy got distracted, I got 13 JAK Rifles to sneak in and launch the real assault on Point 5140 at 9 pm in a frontal mode from the base at Rocky Knob. The enemy was completely surprised by the assault from Rocky Knob,” explained Aul. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Chd: Lost legs 2 months back, bizman end.description: CHANDIGARH: A 34-year-old businessman allegedly hanged himself from a ceiling at his house in Sector 32 on Tuesday night in the third suicide in the city in the last 48 hours. Police said Bhupinder Singh was upset since he had lost his legs in an accident two months back. Cops received information about the incident around 9 pm. They pulled him down from the ceiling and took him to Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32, where doctors declared him brought dead. Police said it did not find any suicide note in the house. On Tuesday, two persons, including a 21-year-old woman, allegedly committed suicide by hanging themselves in different parts of the city. Sandeep (40) of Janata Colony, Nayagaon was found hanging from a tree in a forest area near PGI. In the second incident, Shanu, a resident of Bapu Dham Colony in Sector 26, allegedly hanged herself from a ceiling fan at her house. On June 6, a constable allegedly committed suicide by jumping from third floor at police lines in Sector 26. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Villages with population below 10k can j.description: CHANDIGARH: The Haryana government has decided that villages having a population of less than 10,000 but desirous of having more facilities like augmentation of water supply and sewerage would be covered under the Mahagram B category. A decision to this effect was taken in the 52nd meeting of the Water Supply and Sewerage Board, which met under the chairmanship of chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday. Minister of state for public health engineering Banwari Lal was also present in the meeting. The chief minister said that at present 126 villages with over 10,000 people were being covered under the Mahagram Yojana. Facilities like augmentation of water supply, sewerage, and setting up sewerage treatment plant were being provided under the scheme. He said recently, people of various villages had approached him with a request to carry out development works in their villages also under the scheme, for which they had also offered to contribute funds. He also directed that besides providing training to sewermen, they should also be provided with necessary equipment, uniform, and kit so as to prevent any untoward incident of suffocation while cleaning the sewer. He directed that only trained sewermen should be allowed to enter manholes. It was informed that the training of 703 sewermen had been held in different locations covering 14 circles of the Public Health Engineering department. It was also informed that three robotic machines were being purchased by the department for cleaning manholes. On the successful trial run of these machines, more of them would be purchased. Beer price up few pegs, top brands go mi.description: MOHALI: If you are a beer lover residing in Mohali, drinking beer might be pinching the pocket with regular brands having gone missing from liquor vends. The regular beer brands or rated as affordable brands have gone missing from the Mohali liquor vends. Also, the liquor vends adjoining Chandigarh borders in Mohali have brought the beer rates at par with that of UT. Regular Beer brands like Carlsberg, Tuborg, Carling not being sold at Mohali vends owing to non-issuance of labels to the vend owners. On the other hand, the beer rates in UT have been hiked by Rs 20 per bottle. Beer lovers suspect that it is the nexus between UT and Mohali liquor vend owners as Mohali vends adjoining Chandigarh borders have slashed the rates by Rs 20 per bottle whereas the liquor traders in Chandigarh have hiked the rates by Rs 20 per bottle. Whereas the beer bottle rates in vends farther from the UT border are charging the actual rates which are costlier by Rs 20 to Rs 40 per bottle as that of in Chandigarh. Jasjit Brar who loves beer said, “I am very fond of drinking beer and have observed that the beer rates are lesser by Rs 20 to Rs 30 per bottle in Mohali itself at liquor vends adjoining Chandigarh borders. Miller beer costs Rs 200 at liquor vend adjoining UT whereas the same Beer costs Rs 230 per bottle if purchased from Sector 70 or from farther sectors. So, we prefer buying from liquor vend adjoining UT borders.” A liquor vend owner in Mohali on request of anonymity said, “We have to slash the rates at liquor vends adjoining UT as the vend sales were not picking up. People were preferring jumping the borders to get beer instead of purchasing from vends in Mohali. The rates in vends farther from borders are normal as with price difference of Rs 30 to Rs 40 per bottle than that of vends at borders. As far as cheaper brands are concerned the excise department is yet to release the labels for selling those brands in Mohali.” The excise department officers said that the department has imposed limitations of minimum selling Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Chandigarh: In Selfie with Daughter\u201.description: CHANDIGARH: Gurdaspur’s Sumel Kamal and mother Dr Navjot are one of the three finalists from across India who were felicitated by former President Pranab Mukherjee in New Delhi on Wednesday for winning the ‘Selfie with Daughter’ contest. The award was, perhaps, a recognition of her and her parents’ fight against patriarchy. Resident of Gurdaspur’s Nanowal village, the mother and daughter were the only winners from Punjab and the other two winning entries were from Haryana and Meghalaya. In all, 27,000 participants entered the contest, adjudged by a five-member jury. Sumel (27), a graduate from IIT, Kharagpur, who is working as a “data science analyst” with an international firm, told TOI: “Our village has one of the most skewed sex ratios in Punjab and even the literacy rate is poor. My parents had a tough time raising us and were under pressure to adopt a son in the agrarian atmosphere of our joint family.” Looking back at the childhood she and younger sister Gurnehmat, who is preparing for medical entrance after Class XII now, had, Sumel said her relatives were so obsessed with a boy so much that though they had, once, come home for the funeral of a close relative, they were more inclined to exchanging notes on the birth of her sister. She said her parents were progressive and always had a positive outlook towards their lives. “My father Kamaldeep Singh is a college professor and my mother a school principal. Interestingly, my parents gave me the surname from my father’s maiden name , more so to reply to people who would question them who would carry forward your name or family’s lineage,” she said with a grin. Watching prejudices from close quarters, Sumel expressed her sensitivity on this issue throughout her life, on every platform. From playing the role of a protagonist in a play woven around the subject of female foeticide to participating in awareness campaigns and street plays, she is still determined to do her best for the cause. She said the award motivated her to use every platform and opportunity possible to propel people to give equal amount of love, care and opportunities to daughters. Sunil Jaglan, sarpanch of Bibipur village in Jind district of Haryana who started this contest, said the contest was held from June 10 to 16 to celebrate successful completion of four years of the ‘Selfie with Daughter’ intiative to make people feel proud of their daughters and celebrate their birth. He felt that appreciation from Prime Minister Narender Modi, who has mentioned his initiative during his radio show ‘Mann Ki Baat’, and his visits to Silicon Valley in the US and Wembley Stadium in the UK encouraged him to take this contest to other dimensions. Food security consultative group recomme.description: CHANDIGARH: To streamline the food grains distribution system and to bring transparency, the food security consultative group formed by the Punjab chief minister reviewed the food security schemes and recommended changes in the implementation of existing schemes. The group constituted under the chairmanship of Bharat Bhushan Ashu, Punjab food and civil supplies minister, held its first meeting on Tuesday and discussed delay in verification procedure for smart ration card. It was observed that inordinate delay occurs in verification of beneficiaries due to the performa being passed from the patwari’s office to deputy commissioner. To ease the process, the group suggested that in rural areas, patwaris, block development officers and district food supply controller or his nominee verify the forms of the beneficiaries. In urban areas, inspectors of municipal committees, executive officers and secretary/superintendent level officers and in areas falling under cantonment boards the nominee of the respective deputy commissioner may do the form verification. The group was of the view that this simplification in identification/verification of beneficiaries will increase the reach of food security schemes. To maintain transparency in the procedure, the group proposed to randomly check the data to the tune of 10% by sub-divisional magistrates and 5% by deputy commissioners. It also proposed to rope in more depot holders so that beneficiaries do not have to travel far to get subsidized food grains. Village-wise re-verification of data of existing beneficiaries was also suggested. Aiming greater outreach to the needy, the group agreed to bring youth hostels, old age homes and orphanages under the preview of subsidized ration. Ashu said that chief minister Amarinder Singh had constituted eight consultative groups to review and modify flagship government schemes. The groups have been mandated to review and assess the performance of the schemes and give their respective recommendations for further improvements. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. \nCancer survivors raise the spirits\n.description: As many as 100 cancer survivors along with their doctors celebrated National Cancer Survivors’ Day at IMA Bhawan. The doctors including Dr Sachin Gupta, Dr Sunanadan Sharma, Dr Gautam Goel ,Dr Ritesh Pruthi, Dr Pankaj Kumar and Dr Sajal Kakkar from a Mohali hospital joined survivors in bhangra. Sandeep Dogra said that all have gathered today to show the world that life after a cancer treatment is equally rewarding, fulfilling and inspiring. A jubilant survivor, Surbhi (37) from Pinjore said, “My treatment went on for about 9-month, which was pretty long, but it made me stronger as a person and now I feel fearless and ready to take on any challenge that life will throw at me. The journey completely transformed my outlook towards life & personality and has increased my self-belief.” Another survivor, Amritpal Kaur from Jalandhar said, “Many aspects of life have changed for me like others who sailed in the same boat. No more crying over little issues and most importantly, I have started to sincerely value my life, by taking care of my diet, fitness and most importantly, doing what makes me feel happy.” “My will power to fight cancer came solely from the love and support, i got from my family during the treatment. As a survivor, i request each and every family member to be very positive, calm and hopeful whenever around the patient.”, maintained Lakhwinder from Chandigarh Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Leprosy affected patients struggling for.description: KARNAL: The residents of Indra Chakravarti Gram, who are leprosy-affected and most have lost their fingers and feet due to the disease, on the outskirts of Karnal are struggling for BPL cards. The affected families have raised the issue with the district food and supplies controller (DFSC) and even the chief minister, but have still not got the cards and are thus unable to get oil, sugar, and pulses. “There are around 92 families with around 350 members in Indra Chakravarti Gram, set up in 1969 for leprosy patients. As many as 34 families had applied for BPL ration card some years back but have still not got it. They have visited the DFSC office many times but not got any proper response. Nobody was ready to listen to them,” said Yadgiri Pasi, a resident of the colony, who has been suffering from leprosy for the last 25 years. Many like Kashinath, Gopal Dass, Sanju Devi, Akbar Miyan, Dhani Ram, Kallu Rai and Harmani, who are jobless and without proper homes, are not eligible for BPL cards. They get only five kg wheat in a month but no pulses, sugar and other facilities in the absence of a card. “We are not happy as the department has not even assured to provide us a BPL ration card,” said Kashinath. Tulsi Ram, 70, another colony resident, said his family falls under the poverty line but he has an APL card. DFSC Anil Kumar could not be contacted for his comments despite several attempts. Border area demands still not addressed:.description: CHANDIGARH: Highlighting various issues of Punjab, the state government has submitted that none of the demands of its border areas raised during the Niti Aayog meeting held in April 2017 have been met so far. These demands included special one-time infrastructure development package for border areas, acquisition of farmers’ land by the Union government beyond the border fence and compensation to the farmers for their land rendered ineffective for farming due to periodic military deployment. It was also submitted in the Niti Aayog meeting held on June 15 that the state government, in the third meeting of the governing council of the Aayog in April 2017, had sought similar tax incentives and promotional schemes for Punjab as was being given to the hill states and north-eastern states. The state government had also urged the Union government for special development and maintenance of the border roads under the national highway programme, but these issues have not been addressed by the Centre till date, officials said. It has been submitted that the border areas of the state had been devoid of mainstream development activities on account of its strategic location, hostile conditions with neighbouring Pakistan, cross-border terrorism, problem of smuggling, crime and insurgency. In chief minister Amarinder Singh’s speech circulated during the Niti Aayog meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, it was highlighted that the criteria adopted for allocation of funds — 60% by Centre and 40% by state — by the Union government under the border area development programme (BADP) started in 1986 does not suit the geographically smaller but thickly populated states like Punjab. Rs 178cr sought for police infra near border The chief minister has sought the financial assistance to the tune of Rs 178 crore from the Centre for improving police infrastructure, including new police stations, police lines and residential quarters, in the border areas. He highlighted since the state police is the second line of defence on the international border after the Border Security Force (BSF), there is a need to improve the police infrastructure for better policing and improvement of internal security. Amarinder has also submitted that since the rapid advancement of technology has led to a change in the pattern of crime, the Punjab intelligence wing has taken initiatives to modernize and technologically upgrade itself. The chief minister said the intelligence wing would require Rs 50.29 crore for the project. It was also submitted that as the state law and order wing has a proposal to modernize field units and equip them with latest technology, a sum of Rs 109.70 crore is required for the project. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Activist demands speed governing device.description: CHANDIGARH: Citing safety of riders and public at large, city based activist and advocate Ajay Jagga on Wednesday has written to the UT administration and demanded that speed governing devices should be made mandatory for food delivery bikes in the city. In the letter written to the UT adviser Manoj Parida, Jagga said, “These days most of the people have adapted to the habit of ordering food from online eateries, restaurants and fast-food joints, not wanting to disturb their busy work schedules.” The letter further reads, “These delivery boys rush in the traffic and drive irresponsibly. This speed is very dangerous and can result in fatal accidents. Many hospitals have been reporting high number of accident cases involving food delivery staff. The promise of discounts for not delivering food on time makes consumers happy. Some occasionally even refuse to pay if the meal is not delivered within a stipulated time. The effect of this is borne by delivery boys who commute by two-wheelers. Racing against time, they put their lives at risk and often meet with accidents.” Jagga said that the ‘30-minute or free' advertisements by various pizza joints raises the chances of accidents. And they sometimes prove fatal. He requested the authorities that all the two-wheelers used as home delivery bikes, must be fitted with these devices, so as to keep a check of their speed, who are not only a threat to themselves but to the public as well. Jagga even demanded that an advisory should be issued of 30 days and then their vehicles should be fined, if found without speed governing devices. 34-year-old man commits suicide in Chand.description: CHANDIGARH: A 34-year-old man allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling at his residence on Wednesday. Police said victim was upset over his disability. It is third suicide incident reported from the city in the last 48 hours. Police did not find any suicide note from crime scene. Sector-34 police have registered a case and started probe. Police said that the deceased has been identified as Bhupinder Singh of sector-32. Cops received an information of hanging from sector 32 at around 9 pm. On this information cops rushed the spot and found that the victim was hanging from the ceiling fan at his room in the house. Cops pulled him down and rushed to GMCH-32 , where doctors declared him brought dead and kept his body at mortuary for autopsy. Police said that the victim was doing his own business and he met with an accident in which he lost his both legs around two months ago. Since then he was on wheel chair and had been very upset. Police have ruled out any foul play in the case as there were no internal injuries on the body and said the exact cause of death would only be known after post-mortem report. Sector-34 police have registered a case and initiated inquest proceedings in the matter. On June 18, two persons including one 21-year-old woman had committed suicide by hanging themselves at different parts of city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Eco Sikh plants 550 trees of 15 native v.description: CHANDIGARH : In a bid to increase the green cover, Eco-Sikh , a global organisation of Sikh community committed toward the development of the environment, planted the 15th Guru Nanak sacred forest in the compound of Kheti Bhawan in Directorate of Horticulture department of Punjab government in Mohali on Tuesday. According to Pavneet Singh, assistant manager , some 550 trees of 15 native tree varieties such as Amaltas, Shisham, Baheda, Ashwagandha etc were planted on a 180 sq meter land. Five hundred and fifty saplings are being planted in each such sacred forest to commemorate the upcoming 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev ji.  Quite interestingly, two of the trainees , Ravinder Singh and Kulbir Singh and, students of Public College in Samana, who took training in plantation of eco-forest at Bathinda where Punjab's first Guru Nanak Sacred forest was created , prepared the new forest. Both of them have spearheaded the efforts in setting up some seven new sacred forests, at Kheri Talwandi Malik in Samana , Meemsa in Sangrur, Kheri Jattan , another in village of Fatehgarh Sahib, DC complex and Directorate of Horticulture department in Mohali, so far. Speaking about the new skill of forest making acquired three months ago, from the mentor , a well known environmentalist Shubhendu Sharma, Ravinder Singh said, “I had some free time after completing course of BSC Agriculture which I am utilizing in serving the society with pious work of creating sacred forests as a homage to the Guru Nanak Dev Ji. It is also service to environment which is fast eroding.” He said that it was honour for them that officials of agriculture department also enriched their experience with their tips during this activity.” Kulbir Singh , said that the technique of growing forest with Japenese Miyawaki was so simple that anybody could learn it and do wonders with splendid forest which grows and expands faster without demanding much maintenance and care. Ravneet Singh,  Eco-Sikh project manager said, “The officials of Punjab forest department has been assisting us a lot by providing saplings for our sacred forests across the state. Besides this, we are also purchasing the bulk from the nurseries in Saharanpur as the saplings are not available in sufficient quantity in Punjab alone.” He further told that ateam of eight coordinators of Eco-Sikh were facilitated training in the forest creation technique from Shubhendu Sharma and Gaurav Gujjar at their Jodhpur center sometime ago. He expressed hope that with several trained hands committed in this mission, they would be able to create lot of sacred forests in Punjab by November this year. One in Kasur area of Pakistan has already been created by their team . They said that the efforsts of the eam would continue till they realise their green dreams . The volunteers say that they have also been able to generate awareness also about s variety of native trees. The locals are being told about the native tree saplings. PGGCG-42 likely to start 2 new PG course.description: CHANDIGARH: Post Graduate Government College for Girls, Sector 42, is likely to start two new courses – masters in History and Punjabi, in the new academic session. The last date for online submission of admission forms (centralized admission and non-centralized admission) is June 26. The college, established in 1982, has been accredited ‘A’ Grade by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2019 has placed the college in the Rank Band between 150-200. The college has a distinction of having been selected under the Unnat Bharat Abhiyan, a national programme of MHRD, Government of India. College principal Binu Dogra said, “The college motto ‘Higher still’ reflects the essence of the institution’s being and motivates it to remain persistent in its efforts to progress further. The college focusses not only on the peremptory requirements of the curriculum but also on co-curricular activities which enhance the innate talents of the young minds, our nation’s future and pride.” The 18-acre campus houses 60 spacious classrooms, 23 smart classrooms, seminar room, conference room, multimedia room, placement cell, exclusive IT block, auditorium, well-stocked library, a gymnasium hall, 39 fully equipped computer, language and science laboratories, spacious and hygienic food court, daycare centre, life sciences research lab and landscaped parks. The college is under 24x7 CCTV surveillance facility and provides high-speed Wi-Fi connectivity and on-campus ATM facility. The college caters to the needs of physically disabled/ visually impaired students by providing them with facilities like ramps, washrooms, wheelchair and tactile paving. The college boasts of Sabras, a state-of-the-art auditorium which can accommodate around 550 students The college has one hostel which can accommodate around 265 students. The admissions in the hostel are strictly on merit basis. The hostel rooms are spacious and well-furnished. The hostel mess and the kitchen have been renovated recently along with the washrooms. Chandigarh to install smart meters in tw.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh administration has planned to complete installation of smart meters in city within next two years. Recently, the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) had directed the UT electricity department to conduct its energy audit for its Transmission & Distribution (T&D) System. Whereas, the department in its reply had submitted that energy audit report can be submitted to the commission only after installation of smart meters. A senior UT official said that work of installation of smart meters is in process in city and they have planned to complete the job within next two years. The electricity department has already started the work under its smart grid project. In the first phase, department has allotted a work to a firm to replace 30,000 existing power meters by smart meters in Sector 29, 31, 47, 48, Industrial area phase 1 and 2, and villages Faida, Ram Darbar, Hallo Majra, Raipur Kalan, Makhan Majra and Daria. The work is likely to be completed within next few months. For the project, the power department will also setup a control room in Sector 18, from where they will keep a tab on all consumers, he added. After completion of the first phase, the department will start installation of smart metres in other areas too, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Waterlogging turns poll issue ahead of w.description: BATHINDA: Waterlogging in several parts of Bathinda turned a poll issue ahead of MC ward byelection as BJP and Congress leaders campaigned in knee-deep water at Sirki Bazaar, one of the worst-hit areas in the city, and targeted each other for lack of development. The byelection in ward number 30 is slated for June 21. BJP candidate from the ward Munish Kumar said, “Congress district president Arun Wadhawan has done nothing in the past two years to solve the problem of Sirki Bazaar. We had been asking the government to save residents and shopkeepers by finding a solution to sewerage issues during rains, but to no avail.” BJP candidate Munish Kumar campaign in knee-deep waterArun Wadhawan, whose father is contesting the byelection from Congress, said, “SAD-BJP had ruled for 10 years and never bothered to find any solution, leaving residents and businessmen to suffer year after year. Even now, the Bathinda Municipal Corporation is headed by SAD-BJP and the mayor belongs to SAD, but the alliance never cared to do anything to help Sirki Bazaar. Now we have asked finance minister Manpreet Badal to find some solution.” Meanwhile, residents and shopkeepers said they want a permanent solution to this problem. “We are least interested in politics as we have been at the receiving end for the past several decades. We want a solution to this problem at the earliest. We have to shut our shops and residents of the area have to make a lot of efforts in reaching their homes,” said Pardeep Kumar, a shopkeeper. Bathinda mayor Balwant Rai Nath said efforts are being made to pump out rainwater and finding long-lasting solution to the problem. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

One held with 1 kg charas.description: CHANDIGARH: Operation cell of the UT police has arrested a drug peddler and seized 1 kg charas from his possession from near PGI on Wednesday. According to the cops, the accused has been identified as Karam Chand, a resident of Mani Majra. The operation cell team members had laid a naka on the dividing road of PGI and Khuda Lahora. During checking, they noticed the accused coming towards the check post in his car. The cops stopped him and during checking of his car, they reportedly recovered 1 kg charas. The accused has been arrested and a case has been registered under the NDPS Act. During investigation, the accused revealed that he had procured the drugs from Kullu in Himachal Pradesh. He will be produced before a local court for further remand on Thursday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Haryana receives more rain than Punjab.description: JIND: Three-day span of intermittent rain in the region has benefited farmers as well as public thanks to the drop in temperature. Director of Indian meteorology department in Chandigarh Surender Pal said that farmers would need less water for irrigating their field, especially in case of paddy. “The rain has helped in sowing kharif crops and it’s a good sign for every one as people got relief from scorching heat wave in the region. The data taken form IMD department in Chandigarh shows that Hisar received highest rainfall in Haryana state with 36.7mm in last 24 hours and lowest in Palwal district at 1.7 mm. The data compiled by metrology department shows that Chandigarh recorded highest rainfall at 23.9mm, Haryana 16 mm and Punjab 14.9mm from Monday to Tuesday. Head of meteorology department in Chaudhary Charan Singh Haryana Agriculture University M L Khichar said, “Rain is good for cotton, jawar, bajra, guwar and paddy as famers can skip one irrigation of their fields.” He said that 30.4 degree Celsius temperature was highest and 20 degree was lowest on Tuesday in Hisar. Talking to TOI, national vice-president of Bhartiya Kisan Union Ramphal Kandela agreed with experts on benefit to farmers. Phool Singh Sheokand, a farmer in Jind , said that the rainfall is beneficial for most crops especially in dry area which don’t have irrigation sources. Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said a committee will be set up to explore the possibility of holding simultaneous Lok Sabha and assembly polls even as several opposition parties kept away from a meeting he had called to discuss the "One Nation, One Election" proposal. Defence minister Rajnath Singh said the discussions attended by 21 of the 40 parties represented in Parliament - with three more sending written submissions - saw most parties favouring the proposal even as he added that the PM said a decision will be taken by consensus. The meeting saw key absentees such as Congress, Trinamool, BSP, DMK, SP, TDP and AAP. Left parties attended the discussions, but CPM leader Sitaram Yechury said the party felt the move was "anti-federal" and did not support it and it went against accountability of governments. CPI leader D Raja said the proposal was "impractical and unconstitutional" and would need major constitutional changes. Leaders who attended the meeting included NCP leader Sharad Pawar, CPI's D Raja, Bihar chief minister and JD (U) leader Nitish Kumar, SAD leader Sukhbir Singh Badal, Odisha chief minister and BJD leader Naveen Patnaik and National People's Party leader Conrad Sangma. PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti and National Conference's Farooq Abdullah also attended the meeting. Pawar is understood to have said the proposal would take time to implement and was not a simple matter. Mehbooba and Abdullah are also understood to have pointed out problems in ensuring simultaneous assembly and Lok Sabha polls. BJP ally Shiv Sena was absent as Wednesday was the Foundation Day of the party with a function organised in Mumbai. Among important non-NDA leaders, Patnaik supported the proposal as did YSR Congress's Jaganmohan Reddy. TRS was represented by K Chandrasekhar Rao's son KT Rama Rao, who said the proposal needs more detailed examination before a decision can be arrived at. "The PM will form the committee to look into possibilities of simultaneous polls. Exact nature of the committee will be made public later," Singh told the media. He said the committee will give its suggestions on the subject in a time-bound manner and quoted the PM as saying that "One Nation, One Election" was not an agenda of any party but of the nation and that political parties should consider the larger interest of the country. Modi said all parties will be taken into confidence before taking a final decision and differences of opinion will be taken into account with full seriousness. "Most parties gave their support, CPI(M) and CPI had a difference of opinion but they didn't oppose the idea, just the implementation of it," Singh claimed. "We had invited 40 political parties, out of which 21 parties participated and three other parties sent their opinion on the subjects in writing." BSP chief Mayawati tweeted on Tuesday morning saying she would have attended the all-party meeting if it was on electronic voting machines (EVMs). Besides simultaneous polls, the PM had invited heads of political parties to discuss several issues, including celebration of 75 years of Independence in 2022 and 150th birth anniversary celebrations of Mahatma Gandhi this year. Last August, the Law Commission recommended simultaneous elections to Lok Sabha and state assemblies to save public money. The draft said, "Holding simultaneous elections is not possible within the existing framework of the Constitution." The panel recommended amendments to the Constitution and the Representation of the People Act to ensure simultaneous elections. The law panel as well as a group of senior officials set up by Modi in his first term had suggested that elections can be synchronised in two phases. The next Lok Sabha election could see states due to go to polls within six months before or after national polls brought together. The remainder states could be brought into the fold in the subsequent the Lok Sabha polls. Lack of consensus ensured the proposal never got off the ground. It now appears that Modi is using his fresh majority to give the proposal another strong push by kick-starting a discussion. \nA musical evening of Soul's Diet in ci.description: Chandigarh Sangeet Natak Akademi presented a soulful musical evening by Soul's Diet, a Chandigarh based community music group at Tagore Theatre on Wednesday. Soul's Diet is a Chandigarh based band formed by Vikram and Gurleen. Through this band they are trying to create and present a different flavour of music. They sing poetry written by Sufi mystics and contemporary poets. Their main intention is to bring a moment of stillness and silence in people through their music. The musical evening commenced by singing of self-composed Sufi songs from mystics like Meera Shah, Khwaja Ghulam Fareed, Baba Farid and poems of contemporary poets like Sukhwinder Amrit and Kamaljeet Kaur. \nSummer camp concludes\n.description: This summer, DPS, Chandigarh organised a summer camp for the children from May 16 to June 1, 2019 for tiny tots and May 22 to June 1, 2019 for senior group. The children participated in a number of fun activities like I- spy game, sprinkler fun, Bollywood day, theme parties, grooming sessions and art and craft. Theatre Robotics and Nutty Scientist were offered to students in the senior category. Farmers get relief cheques 2 days before.description: JIND: The farmers of Safidon town in Jind district on Tuesday accused the local patwari (revenue official) of giving them compensation cheques just two days before their expiry date. They have urged the sub-divisional magistrate to look into the matter and act against the patwari. A farmer from Nimnabad village, Major Singh said their compensation was approved in March after a girdawari last year to assess loss to the paddy crop due to flood waters. “But patwari Mangal Singh distributed cheques to farmers on Friday, just two days before their expiry date. As the next two days were Saturday and Sunday, the bank was closed. When we approached to bank for releasing the payment, they refused, saying the encashment date of cheques was over,” he said. While Major Singh got a cheque of Rs 11,000, another farmer Karnail Singh got a compensation of Rs 7,150 and Balinder Singh Rs 12,000. Around 25 to 30 other farmers have also got compensation cheques of similar amount but are still waiting to get them encashed. Safidon SDM Mandeep Kumar said he had taken cognizance of the matter and would urge the bank to release the farmers’ money and if the bank does not do the needful, he would get all the cheques renewed through a proper process. “Even a single rupee of farmers would be given to them at the earliest. May be the delay was may be due to model code of conduct or slow processing of generating cheques by bank officials, but dues would be cleared at the earliest and famers don’t need to worry,” he said. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Chd: Thieves steal 269 vehicles in 163 d.description: CHANDIGARH: Every two days, three vehicles are stolen from the city. That is the strike rate of thieves, succeeding in driving away 269 vehicles in 163 days (till June 13) from the city this year. Their favourite haunts: sectors 34, 36 and 39 and Manimajra - areas that are near Mohali in Punjab and Panchkula in Haryana. If the police are to be believed, drug addicts are behind most of the auto thefts. They steal vehicles to commit snatchings to fulfil their habit, police said. Most of the vehicles were stolen from free parking lots of markets, hospitals and public buildings during daytime. At night, the thieves targeted vehicles outside houses. Out of the stolen vehicles, 217 were two-wheelers, 44 cars and the rest three-wheelers. Police claimed their strictness has prevented the accused from selling stolen vehicles in nearby states like Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Punjab and Haryana. "Mostly, the buyers are scrap dealer. They dismantle the vehicles and sell the part," cops said. However, police have recovered 81 stolen vehicles and arrested 59 auto lifters from different parts of the city so far. Charanjit Singh, DSP (PRO) said police have taken various steps like reshuffling of duty timings after analysing timing of crime to control auto thefts. Under "Roko-Toko Abhiyan" suspected persons or vehicles are checked, especially during odd hours. Police also randomly seal particular sectors with maximum force to rule out any possibility of crime. Police have also been taking unlocked vehicles into their possession and are being released after proper verification. Most importantly, cops put regular surveillance over those released from jail and former auto lifters through beat staff, the DSP said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Picture Credit: Hemant Kumar In Video:Houses turn into graveyards as Muslims in this UP village bury the dead at homeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

IPS probationers calls on DGP Haryana.description: CHANDIGARH: A group of 22 Indian Police Service (IPS) probationers called on Director General of Police (DGP), Haryana, Manoj Yadava at Police Headquarters on Tuesday. While interacting with all the young officers, the DGP gave them important tips on policing and public service and added that they would get ample opportunities in the field to deliver service to the people, providing justice to the needy and poor. He asked them to adopt professional police practices to ensure better delivery of justice. During the one-and-half hour long interaction with them, the DGP shared his experiences on various aspects of policing in field. He also exhorted them to perform with zeal, dedication and high devotion for ensuring better law and order as well as safety and security of public, especially the women and children in their respective places of posting. Apart from this, welfare efforts made by the police personnel should also be rewarded and highlighted. Describing IPS as the best way of serving the mankind, Yadava congratulated the trainee officers for choosing police service as their career. He also extended his best wishes to all the probationers and wished them a bright future ahead. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Chandigarh\u2019s heritage furniture auc.description: CHANDIGARH: In yet another auction of artefacts belonging to the city, furniture items designed by Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret were auctioned for Rs 1.12 crore in New York. While the UT administration failed to preserve its heritage items, a London-based auction house Phillips once again auctioned three heritage furniture items of city beautiful on June 6. A sofa set designed for the high court and Assembly was auctioned for Rs 34.80 lakh, while a pair of armchair was sold for Rs 69.60 lakh. Besides, an executive desk designed for administrative buildings of Chandigarh went under the hammer for Rs 7.39 lakh. Le Corbusier and his cousin Pierre Jeanneret had designed the aforementioned items. Both used to design chairs, tables, stools, and racks for government offices in the late 1950s. The designed furniture lot was replaced in the late 1980s and early 1990s, after which the administration had tossed the items in its backyards and stores. Unaware of the furniture's international worth, most UT departments had auctioned the old furniture thinking it as junk. Meanwhile, activist Ajay Jagga has written to the home minister, Amit Shah and minister for external affairs Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and sought inquiry into the auction of these furniture items. He further requested the authorities to look into the matter and seek a report on the Protection Against Trafficking in Cultural Property, specially of Chandigarh, so that the loopholes can be plugged and a suitable action be taken, after ascertaining the facts. To preserve its heritage artefacts, Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) had recently asked the UT administration for taking corrective steps. Director general of ASI had advised the administration to prepare an inventory of heritage items with subsequent authentication of their authorship. The ASI had also suggested that a museum dedicated to Le Corbusier and his team can be established by the administration, which will prevent taking these works of art out of India. Heritage furniture goes under the hammer During his stay in Chandigarh, Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret designed several pieces of furniture. Some of the prototypes are present at Government Museum and Art Gallery, Sector 10. Jeanneret used the furniture in the house he stayed in at Sector 5. He was so fond of the city that after his death, his ashes were immersed in Sukhna Lake as he had desired. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" EC issues Deol notice for breaching poll.description: AMRITSAR: The Election Commission has issued a notice to actor-turned-politician Sunny Deol for crossing the poll expenditure limit in the recently concluded Lok Sabha elections. Gurdaspur deputy commissioner Vipul Aggarwal told TOI on Wednesday that the newly-elected Gurdaspur MP’s expenses were a bit more as compared to the prescribed limit of Rs 70 lakh. “After every election, we take stock of expenditure done by all the candidates. We reconcile the expenses recorded with us and with the candidate,” he said. While refusing to disclose the extra amount of money spent by Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol, the deputy commissioner said the reconciliation process was going on so it wouldn’t be possible give any final figure. Sunny had contested the Lok Sabha elections on BJP ticket from Gurdaspur parliamentary constituency and defeated Congress Punjab president Sunil Jakhar. 'Punjab govt to bear treatment expenses.description: BATHINDA: Punjab minister Charanjit Singh Channi on Tuesday met the woman who was mercilessly beaten up last week by six persons and announced that the state government will bear the expenses incurred on her treatment. He visited the victim at Guru Gobind Singh Medical College in Faridkot. Channi also announced the state government will act tough against the accused persons. He reiterated that the Punjab government is duty bound to provide free, transparent and fearless environment to every section of the society and said there will be no injustice against anyone.
