BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhatinda: Rain cheer for paddy, cotton g.description: BATHINDA: Rains that lashed the Bathinda region on Monday night and Tuesday morning brought smiles on the faces of farmers, especially paddy growers. Showers drastically decreased their dependence on agriculture pump sets (tubewells) to water their fields during or after transplantation for a couple of days. Battling hot and humid weather for the past several days, the cotton growers too were happy following the rains. The long dry spell proves unfavourable for both the crops. However, more rains can be harmful for cotton and more so when water stagnates at the bottom of the plant, hitting the growth of the crop. The agriculture department officials are also elated over the rains which were long overdue for smooth transplantation of paddy and saving the cotton from long dry spell. “We were praying for rains to our cotton crop some much-needed relief from very hot and humid weather. But we know that if rains continue for long, it could be harmful for cotton,” said Sangat village farmers Baldev Singh and Hukum Singh. Farmers Mohinder Singh and Mukhtiar Singh at Sivian village said, “We were ready to transplant paddy and were waiting for our turn to draw water through motors on Monday evening. But with the rain, now we may not need water for a couple of days which will save a lot of electricity.” The paddy transplantation is at full swing since June 13, official date fixed by the state government. Paddy need a lot of water as the fields had to be left full of water. The rain, however, left vegetable growers in a spot of bother. The rains are unfavourable for watermelons, grapes and some other crops and affect their sale. Bathinda chief agriculture officer Guraditta Singh said the rain had come at a time when it was needed the most for transplantation of paddy. This rain will ease pressure on PSPCL for a couple of days, he added. Bathinda areas in troubled watersThe 28mm rainfall recorded in Bathinda however caused a lot of hardships to town residents. Many of the areas, including upscale civil station which houses district administrative complex (DAC), district judicial courts, the residences of deputy commissioner, IG, SSP, district and sessions judge and a score of civil, police and judicial officers were inundated. People had a difficult time in reaching DAC and courts with roads leading to these offices getting waterlogged. The rear side of DAC, power house road, Sirki Bazaar were submerged in knee-deep water. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Chandigarh: Schools told to grow own veg.description: CHANDIGARH: In the recent Project approval boards meeting held for midday meal (MDM), the Union ministry of human resource development (MHRD) has recommended that all Union Territories should develop school nutrition gardens from where vegetables and fruits can be used for midday meal. The ministry has also recommended that the UTs should approach jails, gurdwaras and temples for providing mid-day meal. Further they have also suggested cooking competition among the helpers wherein students would be judges. According to MHRD, temples, gurdwaras and jails can be involved in MDM scheme. “Temples and gurdwaras have greater reach among the community and this can help in wider publicity for midday meal scheme. These religious places can also adopt some schools in their vicinity for providing meals as it would give enhanced sense of ownership of the midday meal scheme among the local community,” the MHRD stated. All cook-cum-helpers as well as interested members of the community can take part in the cooking competition. It will include cooking of pulses/vegetables/different types of chapattis, methods of cooking, food safety issues and hand washing. Two children each from primary and upper primary classes and nutritionists from Home Science College may be selected as judges for the same. The MHRD, in its presentation uploaded online, has recommended that all UTs have school nutrition gardens (SNGs). The move will also help students get safe and organic food with better nutritional value and learn new skills. As per the ministry, SNG is a place where herbs, fruits and vegetables are grown on school premises to be used in the preparation of midday meal. In Chandigarh, some of the schools already have such an area that they call kitchen gardens. TOI had earlier reported how some of the schools in the UT, including GMSSS in Sector 47 and Sector 26, have been growing huge quantities of vegetables. These vegetables were then being used in midday meal kitchen of the schools. Chandigarh was also praised at national level for this initiative. The Union ministry has, however, recommended that this initiative should be undertaken in every government school. The UT administration was also mulling asking all schools to grow veggies for MDM as government schools have huge campus. The initiative will help address malnutrition and micro nutrient deficiencies, will give children first-hand experience with nature and gardening, Large piece of land is not required even roof tops can be used for growing vegetable/fruits in containers, the MHRD has stated. Plants may also be grown in small containers, cans, jars, discarded earthen pots, wooden boxes, ceramic sinks, food tins, and gunny bags in case sufficient land is not available. The MHRD has further recommended that schools can tie up with local departments like Krishi Vigyan Kendras, department of agriculture/ horticulture, Food and Nutrition Board and agriculture universities for collaboration. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Repudiating accident claim proves costly.description: CHANDIGARH: The district consumer disputes redressal forum has directed United India Insurance Company Limited to pay Rs 35,000 for repudiating the claim of a Manimajra resident. They were also directed to pay the claim amount of Rs 48,100 to the complainant. Baaj Mohamad had stated in his complaint that on November 20, 2017, his insured tipper overturned in Phase 3, Mohali, while unloading material from the vehicle. In the process, factory-fitted hydraulic system of the tipper got severely damaged. Following this, the insurance firm was intimated about the loss/ damage to the vehicle. Upon this, a surveyor was appointed by the company to assess the extent of loss/ damage caused to the insured vehicle. The surveyor visited the complainant on November 24, 2017, and gave a go ahead to get the vehicle repaired from the market and told Baaj to get a second-hand hydraulic system fitted for which he would be fully reimbursed by the insurer. The complainant acted accordingly and the repairs incurred a sum of Rs 1.53 lakh, including towing charges to the tune of Rs 8,000. In the meantime, another surveyor appointed by the company visited the complainant and took photographs of the damaged parts of the vehicle and of the insured tipper post repair. Besides collecting a copy of the insurance policy, the surveyor promised full reimbursement against the amount spent. However, on January 4, 2018, the insurer rejected the claim. In its reply, the insurance firm stated that the claim was rightly repudiated as the loss caused to the vehicle was not covered under IMT 47 and 52. The forum after hearing both the parties observed, “If a vehicle is overturned and damaged, that would be a part of accident and when the accident is covered under the terms and conditions of the policy, overturning could not be excluded from that. If it was to be excluded, there should have been specific mention of the same in the cover note/ policy. In absence of such a mention, the insurance company cannot say that since no premium was paid for overturning, the risk of overturning was not covered.” It was further stated that the insurer or its agents were under obligation to disclose the extra premium for overturning and if the same was not paid, overturning would not be covered. But from the record, it does not appear that this obligation was discharged by the agents of the insurance company and thus the firm cannot claim the benefit of the overturning exclusion clause. “In view of the above findings, we are of the concerted opinion that the repudiation of claim of the complainant is wholly unjustified and amounts to deficiency in service on the part of the company, which certainly has caused immense, mental and physical harassment to the complainant,” the forum observed. They were then directed to pay up. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Haryana: Chief secretary directs to expe.description: CHANDIGARH: Haryana chief secretary, DS Dhesi on Wednesday directed the concerned officers to expedite the ongoing process of rail network projects being implemented by the Regional Rapid Transit System(RRTS) in the state. The chief secretary was reviewing the rail network projects being implemented by the RRTS. Dhesi was informed that the transit system has been proposed to be constructed from Sarai Kale Khan in Delhi to Gurugram and further till Shahjahanpur-Neemrana-Behror. In this project, NNB stations would be constructed between Delhi and Bawal at Sarai Kale Khan, Jor Bagh, Munirka, Aerocity, Udyog Vihar, Sector 17, Rajiv Chowk, Khedki daulah, Manesar, Pachgaon, Bilaspur Chowk, Dharuhera, MBIR, Rewari and Bawal. The length of the route is 106 kilometers, in which Haryana’s share is 81.86 km This project will give an impetus to development and investment in South Haryana, especially in Gurugram. The alignment for the RRTS project will be elevated from old Delhi road in Gurugram to Signature Tower Chowk through Lt. Atul Kataria Chowk and then from NH-48 to Rajiv Chowk. After that, the alignment is underground from Kherki Daula, where it will be above the ground till IMT Manesar. Before entering Rajasthan, this alignment will go up to Dharuhera, Rewari and Bawal along with National Highway. For this project, the approval of National Highway Authority of India has been obtained. For the implementation of this project, an office is being established in Gurugram by National Capital Region Transport Corporation. The construction work of this rail transit system will soon be started in the state. Those present included Principal Secretary, Industry and Commerce, Devender Singh, Additional Chief Secretary, Finance Department, T.V.S.N. Prasad, Principal Secretary, Town and Country Planning, Apurv Kumar Singh, Chief Administrator, Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran, D. Suresh and other senior officers. 6 people die on Mohali roads every week,.description: MOHALI: As many as six people lose their lives every week in road accidents in Mohali — the second highest fatality rate in Punjab — according to a government study on road safety analysis and identification of accident-prone areas. The office of traffic adviser, Punjab, took note of accidents from 2016 to 2018 in the study that found Rupnagar had the highest death rate out of the 22 districts in the state. The report was tabled in a meeting chaired by senior superintendent of police (SSP) to review traffic-related problems in the district. According to the report, 310 people died in 2017 and 290 in 2016 in Mohali. The number of deaths in 2018 was 297. The study found that the months of February, March, April, October and December were relatively more dangerous as regard to fatal accidents. The report was divided into three main aspects — dealing with general trends of accidents over the past three years along with its various analysis; dealing with the availability of resources within the state and in Mohali along with corresponding road accidents and highway patrol vehicle deployment. A detailed police station wise analysis revealed that Lalru, Derabassi and Zirakpur were the three police stations out of 14 in which more than 47% deaths were reported. All are on Ambala-Zirakpur national highway. Sohana and Kharar sadar police came next. In Lalru, 52 people lost their lives in 2017 followed by 43 in Derabassi, 40 in Zirakpur and 33 in Sohana in 2017. The report said 135 people died on the stretch between Zirakpur and Jharmari in 2017. Flaws detected in airport road designPunjab traffic adviser Navdeep Asija had also conducted a three-dimensional (3D) safety audit using drones to investigate the geometric design of three blind spots on the airport road in Mohali. The report revealed major flaws in design and engineering, proving that the road is not pedestrian and cyclist-friendly. The 3D audit was conducted on road crossings near Sohana gurdwara, IISER intersection and Sector 66-67 light point intersections. The report suggested that construction of modern roundabouts on these strategic locations could prove efficient and safer. Asija said, “We have conducted 3D study of geometric design of three blind spots on the airport road in Mohali using drones and have observed major flaws in design which causes accidents and make airport road unsafe for people. The road is not safe for pedestrians and cyclists as they are the majority of accident victims. So, we have laid special design emphasis for safety of pedestrians and cyclists while suggesting improvements. None of the traffic lights on these junctions is as per the traffic volume.” He said the office conducted the drone survey last month and on the basis of its findings prepared a report on March 12. It has been submitted to the inspector general, traffic, and would be forwarded to Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA) for corrective action. Set up expert group to deal with tax eva.description: CHANDIGARH: Punjab government has suggested that the Union government sets up an expert group to deal with the issue of large scale tax evasion, particularly income tax and corporate tax by numerous companies. It has submitted that India’s direct tax collection, “which is untapped and needs immediate attention, is just 6.15% of the gross domestic product (GDP), which is well below our neighbour China (11.35%), the US (21.99%), the UK (22.86%), Germany (29.15%) and France (32.83%)”. The authorities have not been able to curb tax evasion as in a number of such cases, the offenders, if caught, can get away since the offences are compoundable and the culprits just have to pay the tax demand and penalty along with the interest. Chief minister Amarinder Singh made this suggestion during the fifth meeting of the governing council of the Niti Aayog held in New Delhi on June 15. Although Capt Amarinder could not attend the meeting due to health reasons, his speech was circulated in the meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Amarinder submitted that the direct tax reform needed instant attention to ensure that its collection was raised to at least 10%. He reasoned that there was a need for mobilization of financial resources to deal better with multiple challenges like unemployment, inequality and poverty, which require concerted efforts from the Centre and the state governments. “The introduction of GST, which incidentally faces a number of issues that we hope will get addressed at the earliest, has improved indirect tax revenue to some extent. However, the direct tax front needs immediate attention,” he added. Direct taxes include corporation tax, taxes on income, wealth tax, gift tax, estate duty, interest tax, land revenue, agriculture tax, hotel receipts tax and expenditure tax. The Union finance ministry, in the interim budget for the finance year 2019-20 presented in February, had set the target of direct tax collection to the tune of Rs 13.8 lakh crores. In the last few years, the Union government has not been able to meet its set budget targets of direct tax collection. Rights group report The report released by the international rights group, Oxfam, last year highlights the growing income inequality in India, where the country’s top 1% population held 73% of its total wealth in 2017. The Oxfam report of 2016 revealed that India’s richest 1% population held 58% of the country’s total wealth. Whereas 67 crore population of India, comprising the population’s poorest half, saw their wealth rise by just 1% in 2017. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

12 of 13 Punjab MPs take oath in Punjabi.description: JALANDHAR: Twelve out of the 13 MPs from Punjab took their oath as members of the 17th Lok Sabha in Punjabi this time, barring Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol. It is probably the first instance in recent times that MPs from all parties — Congress, Shiromani Akali Dal, BJP and Aam Aadmi Party — preferred to take oath in the state language. Only Deol took his oath in English. While two Union ministers Harsimrat Kaur Badal and Som Parkash had taken their oath in Punjabi on Monday, 10 other MPs followed suit on Tuesday. Linguistic diversity was the flavour of the oath-taking this time as MPs from across India predominantly took oath in their mother tongue, be it Dogri, Kannada or Konkani. Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol takes the oath of office in EnglishOver a fornight before on May 30, Harsimrat and Som Parkash had taken their ministerial oath in English, but they were trolled by Punjabi netizens. Second-time Jalandhar MP Chaudhary Santokh Singh said it was for the first time that 12 out of 13 MPs had taken oath in Punjabi. Former MP Prem Singh Chandumajra, who was elected to Lok Sabha thrice, said it was after quite some time that such a large number of MPs from Punjab had taken oath in Punjabit. "It was probably in 1977 that all Punjab MPs, barring one, had taken oath in Punjabi," he said. Three-time MP Ravneet Bittu also said that the number this time was maximum. The symbolism of MPs across parties and from diverse communities taking their oath in Punjabi in the Parliament assumes significance for Punjab, where language was made the reason of communal rift in 1950s and 60s and the state witnessed a bitter campaign against Punjabi language. While SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal concluded his oath with Sikh greeting “Waheguru Ji ka Khalsa, Waheguru Ji Ki Fateh”, Sanguru MP Bhagwant Mann concluded with “Inqalab Zindabad”. Sukhbir using the Sikh salutation is being seen as an attempt to assert the Panthic identity of the Akali Dal as the party trying hard to recover its lost base. Anandpur Sahib MP Manish Tewari, who is usually seen speaking in English, also took his oath in Punjabi. His father late Prof V N Tewari, who was a member of Rajya Sabha, was a prominent scholar of Punjabi literature. The move was also lauded by Punjabi netizens. “It will not only help in getting Punjabi language better recognition at the national level, but will also help to strengthen the spirit of Punjabiyat and Punjabi identity. The MPs should now make their speeches also in Punjabi in Parliament,” said Satnam Singh Manak, president of Punjabi Jagriti Manch, which takes out an annual Punjabi march on international Language Day. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. \nNGO organizes fund raiser for special.description: Model and actress, Neet Mahal was in town recently to take part in a fund raiser event for special children. In the event, she was joined by Gagan Verma, Mr Supermodel Universe, Ruby Singh, actor and model and fitness expert Dr Vibha Bawa, winner of North Indian Queen 2018 and Ayurveda expert Sanjana Sharma, ex-banker and Mrs. India Beauty Queen 2018, Dr Tetiana Kapranova an endocrinologist, therapist and fashion model, Sam Rattan, actor-model and anchor, Dr Rimple Sharma, Mrs. Chandigarh Queen 2018. ‘Elysian Diva’, the fund raiser event was organized by Empower, a city based project, which works for special children betterment in association with Surkhwabh. The event was also a tribute to the supreme sacrifice of Deputy Commandant Joy Lal whose 20 th martyrdom day falls on May 30. During occasion, around dozen special children walked the ramp along with celebrities. Wheelchair Indian Cricket team players including Ranjit Singh, Nirmal Singh and Veer Singh Sandhu also joined kids in ramp walk and show. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Punjab girl who graduated from IIT Khara.description: CHANDIGARH: Sumel Kamal and her mother Dr Navjot, resident of Nanowal village of Gurdaspur district are one of the three finalists who were felicitated by former president Pranab Mukherjee for winning the 'Best Selfie with Daughter' contest in New Delhi on Wednesday. Out of total 27,000 participants, these three finalists, the other came from Mewat and Meghalaya respectively, were selected by a jury of five members. Sumel Kamal, 27, graduate from IIT Kharagpur who is currently working as Data Science Analyst with Accenture Applied Intelligence told TOI, “I come from Nanowal village which has one of the most skewed sex ratio and poor literacy rate in Punjab. My parents had a tough time raising us under societal pressure of adopting a son in agrarian atmosphere of our joint family.” Looking back at the difficult childhood, which she and her younger sister Gurnehmat had, who is preparing for her medical entrance exams after class XII, she shared as to how the relatives seemed more inclined to exchange somber notes on birth of her younger sister just few days after her birth than mourning death of a close family member, occasion for which they had gathered in the house. She credited her parents for giving progressive and positive outlook to their lives in this dismal scenario. “My father Kamaldeep Singh is a college professor and my mother a school principal. Quite interestingly, my parents gave me surname from my father’s maiden name, more so to give befitting reply to the people who would question them who would carry forward your name or family’s lineage,” she said with grin. Watching the prejudices from close quarters, Sumel expressed her sensitivity on this issue at every platform provided. From playing the role of a protagonist in a play woven around the subject of female foeticide to participating in awareness campaigns and street plays later on, she is determined to do her bit and best for the cause. She said that the felicitation from former president has motivated me to utilize every platform and opportunity possible to propel people to give equal amount of love, care and opportunities to their daughters. Sunil Jaglan, sarpanch of Bibipur village in Jind district of Haryana who started this contest said that this contest was held from June 10 to 16 to celebrate successful completion of four years of the intiative of clicking selfie with daughter to make people feel proud of their daughters and celebrate their birth. He felt that appreciation from Prime Minister Narender Modi who has mentioned his initiative during his radio show ‘Mann Ki Baat’ and his visits to Silicon Valley in American and Wembley Stadium in London gave him more encouragement to take this contest to other dimensions where he has opened many mini libraries for girls in Haryana. \nPhilosophical perspective of Ganga thr.description: Pracheen Kala Kendra organized a spectacular dance ballet ‘Ganga’ by the students of Kendra in the direction of Kathak exponent Dr. Samira Koser at Tagore Theatre. There were about 80 participants between the ages of 5 to 55, who gave ample proof of training given bytheir Guru Koser. This programme was split in two parts, one was Dance ballet Ganga and other, pure kathak dance presentations of Jaipur Gharana. After the lighting of traditional lamp, the programme got a majestic start with Ganga. This dance ballet gives a message that we should awaken and purify Ganga as well as our souls and be good human beings before it’s too late. This ballet was presented by Shubhra Koser, Amrita, Anu, Divya, Mehak, Savitri, Tanaya, Sonika, anushka, Geetika, Pranjal , Ojaswita , Sargam and Gursimran. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Panjab University to probe shooting of \.description: CHANDIGARH: Panjab University has decided to launch an inquiry to learn how the video of Punjabi singer Jass Manak’s recently released song ‘Bandook’, which allegedly promotes gun culture, got shot on the university campus, registrar Karamjeet Singh said on Tuesday. Assistant professor Pandit Rao Dharennavar of PU-affiliated Post Graduate Government College, Sector 46, who had earlier protested against the playing of vulgar songs on school and college campuses in the city, gave a complaint to the registrar to inquire how the singer got permission to shoot the song’s video on the campus. The song in dock, Bandook, is part of a movie Sikandar 2 that will hit the theatres on August 2. The song was released about a week ago on YouTube and has been viewed 5 million times so far. Parts of the video of the song have been shot at hostel number 4, Dr Abdul Kalam Bhawan and the road connecting gate 1 of the university to Gandhi Bhawan. In his complaint, Dharennavar stated that the song promoted gun culture and was not suitable for students of the university. “When the authorities have issued orders banning the playing of vulgar, drugs and violence promoting songs on the campus, how come this song got permission to be shot here” Dharennavar asked. The registrar said he has received the complaint and an inquiry will be launched in the matter. “This is absolutely wrong. Any type of music promoting vulgarity, drugs and violence is not allowed on the campus,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Court allows fraud accused to travel abr.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh district court allowed revision petition in a cheating case whereby accused Guneeta Grover had sought permission to travel abroad for 15 days. The lower court had rejected the application which was challenged in the appellate court which after hearing the arguments allowed the accused to go abroad with certain conditions. It was mentioned in the petition that petitioner is one of the directors of M/s KLG Finance Private Limited. She had applied for anticipatory bail which was allowed by this court vide order dated December 6, 2018, on the condition that petitioner shall deposit her passport with the police and shall not leave India without prior permission of trial court. It was further submitted that petitioner wants to go to Thailand and Singapore with her two daughters for a week in order to meet her relatives and friends during June 5 to June 28 on account of summer vacations of her daughters. Therefore, she had moved an application before lower court seeking permission to go abroad which was dismissed on the ground that since she has not deposited her passport with the police. The prosecution opposed this revision petition and stated that in case the permission is granted to the applicant to go abroad, there is every likelihood of her absconding as she will not return to India and hence the prayer for dismissal of the present revision petition was made. Guneeta Grover was arrayed as an accused in a case whereby an FIR was registered against her on November 22, under sections 420, 467 468 471, 120-B of the IPC at PS-26, Chandigarh and on December 6, 2018. She was granted concession of anticipatory bail subject to conditions including the condition not to leave the country without the permission of the court. 3 Punjab men convicted for fake governme.description: CHANDIGARH: A local court in Panchkula has convicted three persons who had collected Rs 43.31 lakh from gullible youths for recruitment as computer teachers for a society, which had a name that was similar to a government-run scheme. In this case, Sandeep Singh, Mandeep Singh and Amit Kumar, all residents of Tarn Taran district of Punjab, had collected Rs 43.31 lakh from 11,707 unemployed persons from Punjab by inviting applications for recruitment of computer personnel for various offices of a society, whose name was similar to the Sarv Siksha Abhiyan. “... They must have felt cheated during such phase of their life where they were struggling for their survival and were searching for employment. Such meticulously planned crimes impact the society on a larger scale,” observed judicial magistrate first class (JMIC) Panchkula, Viren Kadyan while sentencing the accused. LPAI accelerates ICP work, agencies sugg.description: DERA BABA NANAK: The Land Port Authority of India (LPAI) has accelerated construction of the integrated checkpost (ICP) at Dera Baba Nanak to facilitate pilgrimage. The first jatha is expected to leave for Gurdwara Darbar Sahib, Kartarpur Sahib, Pakistan through the Kartarpur Corridor after four months. The construction work got the momentum after the recent visits of Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol and Punjab chief secretary Karan Avtar Singh, who emphasized the need to expedite the work of ICP. In March, LPAI had begun the symbolical construction of the ICP by levelling 50 acres of land, but the work of the first phase couldn’t be started due to delay in awarding the contract. “Now the work has picked up pace and we have begun construction work of passenger terminal building which will have facilities of immigration, customs, bank, rest room, baggage trolleys and basic medical facilities under one roof,” said LPAI manager Sukhdev Singh while talking to TOI on Wednesday, adding that the work of the first phase of 16 acres of ICP would be completed by October 31. LPAI aims to complete and operationalize the first phase as soon as possible so that pilgrimage is not affected when the construction work in the remaining 34 acres in the second phase of ICP gets underway. Meanwhile, highly-placed sources said a meeting of security officials from various agencies, including Army, was held at Dera Baba Nanak on Wednesday to discuss the issue of security of pilgrims and ICP and possible threats. Security agencies have suggested constructing an underground parking lot at the ICP so that in case of eventuality, the operational manpower could be shifted to the underground parking. The other security features suggested by security officials included installation of automatic bollards at the international gate. “In case of an attack, the gate can be easily demolished, but the bollards will create obstacles in the entry of armoured vehicles giving precious times to Indian forces to react,” said sources. Another suggestion made was to construct a demolition chamber under the Indian bridge, so that it could be disposed of immediately in event of an attack from Pakistan side, added sources. MA from Panjab University, blind man en.description: CHANDIGARH: Billu Paswan, 38, suffering from 100% visual disability, is living on the footpath as the UT authorities have turned a blind eye to his problems. Originally hailing from Bihar, Paswan has been living in Chandigarh for 29 years. He did his schooling from the city and went on to pursue an MA in Hindi from Panjab University (PU). However, after he was evicted from the university hostel in 2017 since he was no longer a student, he was forced to live on footpath in absence of any job or caretaker. He has pitched a tent in front of a temple in Sector 29, and performs his morning ablutions two metres from his sleeping bed, as, he says, he has no one to guide him. Paswan said his mother was no more and his father has been in a psychiatric hospital for past over a decade. He said his siblings had abandoned him and he had no knowledge of their whereabouts. In February, Paswan, through a Good Samaritan, had written a letter to the social welfare and child department of the UT administration to help him provide some assistance in terms of shelter and food. However, the administration took notice of his complaint only recently and passed it on to registrar of PU since the complaint mentioned that Paswan was evicted from PU hostel. The university said under its policies, they allot hostel to blind students as soon as they get admission. "Billu was also allotted the hostel on ground floor near the mess. He lived here for around 10 years. He kept taking admissions in courses to stay in hostel but kept failing. There were also multiple complaints from students about Billu's hygiene. After he was no longer a student, we had to serve him an eviction notice," said a university official. Billu said he wanted the administration to rehabilitate him at a shelter home. He said wherever he approached, he was denied entry because he did not have any caretaker. "Here on footpath under a tree, my life has become miserable. I have to brave harsh weather. The money people give to me is always stolen. My mobile phone has been stolen three times. After my eviction from the PU hostel in 2017, I had gone to Rohtak to work at a blind school, but had to leave when they did not pay me for three months. Now, my only request is to administration get me a shelter and engage me in a job that would be suitable for a blind man," he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patiala: Drug addict gets new life.description: PATIALA: A government-run drug de-addiction and rehabilitation centre at Brahman Majra in Fatehgarh Sahib has given a new life to a Sirhind-based patient, who has been a drug addict for the last six years. Besides diagnosing him, the doctors at the centre gave him counselling and strengthened his mind to fight his addiction. With sheer determination, he quit drugs and is now living happily with his family, which was earlier troubled by his addiction. The patient now guides others to lead a healthy life. He says that an addict spoils everyone's life around him. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Groundwater dip: Punjab for special stat.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government has urged the Centre to grant special category state status to the state under the Accelerated Irrigation Benefits Programme (AIBP) to strengthen the irrigation infrastructure due to over exploitation of groundwater. In its submissions during the Niti Aayog meeting on June 15, it was highlighted that the water table is falling in almost 85% area of the state. Out of the total 138 blocks in Punjab, 109 blocks are over-exploited, two critical and five semi-critical, and there is an annual over exploitation of groundwater to the extent of 14.20 billion cubic metre annually. “It is strongly felt that it would be in national interest that the state gets specific grant of Rs 2,575 crore from 2020-21 to 2024-25 by the 15th finance commission so that projects for modernization of canal systems can be taken up and the declining trend of groundwater level be reversed,” state chief minister Capt Amarinder Singh has submitted. He has requested the central government to approve the project of extension, renovation and modernization of canals being fed from Satluj, amounting to over Rs 918 crore, and revamp of various distributaries systems along with Upper Bari Doab Canal at a cost of over Rs 1,112 crore. The state government has cited the latest report by the central ground water board that has indicated that the water in all the three underground natural aquifers in Punjab shall finish in next 20-25 years. Also, the sub surface water in the state is depleting at a rate of more than 50 cm every year. Procurement of maize, pulsesPunjab government has suggested that there is a need to come up with some robust system of the central government sponsored procurement of alternative crops which will also reduce farmers’ dependence on wheat and paddy, and also conserve natural resources. It has been highlighted that the minimum support price (MSP) of crops other than wheat and paddy is also fixed by the central government, but there is no mechanism for procurement of crops like maize, pulses and oilseeds. Therefore, prices of these crops remain subdued in market and farmers have to suffer. Doubling farmers incomeChief minister Capt Amarinder Singh has sought Niti Aayog’s support for preparing a road map to double farmers’ income by 2022 and has said that it must include clear and precise plans specific to the state, crop and agri-climatic conditions. At the same time, the chief minister has sought Prime Minister’s personnel intervention for announcing national debt waiver for farming community including farm labourers. It has also been suggested that the sum of Rs 6,000 per year under the PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi should be increased to at least Rs 12,000 per year and to also give similar financial assistance to farm workers. Relief for drought situationThough the state government has submitted that Punjab is drought protected due to 100% assured irrigation but in the event of deficient rains whose frequency is increasing, it would need a sum or around Rs 2,000 crore in drought like situation given the specific agro-climatic conditions of state. It has been suggested that the central government should enhance the subsidy on intelligent irrigation techniques from present level of 30% to 70%. At the same time, the central government should also enhance the allocation under Prime Minister Krishi Sinchai Yojna to Punjab to Rs 1,000 crore per annum. Denied leave to share research in German.description: CHANDIGARH: On being denied leave to present a research paper in Germany, MCM DAV assistant professor Renu Bala of physics department moved the Punjab and Haryana high court, and justice was duly served. Bala along with Vinok Ashokan and former Panjab University vice-chancellor Kare N Pathak were called to present their research paper at FH Munster University of Applied Sciences in Germany on a fully sponsored programme by the German government. However, Bala was denied the desired leave by her college that cited her requirement in admission duty for the upcoming admissions. The principal allowed her a leave, but only till June 23. Bala then approached the high court seeking allowance to visit to Germany for the programme between June 15 and July 7. The court in its order observed that Bala’s tickets were booked and a visa to her was issued by the German government. MCM DAV College PRO Ashish said Bala left the country for the programme after the court’s order. Associate professor Renu Bedi, dean sciences and head of physics department, said the authorities should encourage and feel proud when teachers are given opportunities to visit abroad to attend conferences/ workshops, that too fully sponsored. “The NAAC and NIRF rankings of colleges are also based on such achievements,” Bedi said. The professors’ research paper is on theoretical condense matter physics that studied the physical properties of quantum nanowire, such as the flow of electrons. The study has potential applications in building superfast quantum computers that are only talked about and have not been a reality so far. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kurukshetra: Police probe murder angle i.description: KURUKSHETRA: The Kurukshetra police on Monday registered a case of murder in connection with the death of a student of National Institute of Technology (NIT) Kurukshetra who reportedly died after falling from the third floor of institute's hostel. The case was registered on the complaint of Ritik Batra’s father Rajnish Batra who raised suspicions that his son had been murdered. Ritik belonged to Karnal and was studying in first year of Bachelor of Technology (BTech) at the NIT Kurukshetra campus. “Ritik was staying in room number 123 of hostel number 1 of the NIT. I talked to him on May 20 at around 10pm. After an hour, my wife received a call on her mobile phone from someone who informed her that Ritik fell from the third floor of the hostel. We rushed towards Kurukshetra, but on the way we were informed that he was being taken to a private hospital in Karnal and we reached there. After some time, my son was brought to the hospital in Karnal by his roommate Shivam and warden DK. On May 21, we shifted him to a private hospital in Gurugram for better treatment, where he succumbed to his injuries on May 29 at around 7pm,” Rajnish stated in his FIR. “On May 30, policemen from Third Gate police post in Kurukshetra reached Gurugram. They claimed that Ritik died after slipping from the third floor of hostel number 10. My son’s mobile phone, bag, purse, ATM, Aadhar card are missing. My son lived in hostel number 1 but the incident is reported to be from hostel number 10. So far, the police have not obtained the call details of my son’s mobile phone and nor have they obtained the CCTV footage from hostel number 10. I suspect that my son has been murdered,” Rajnish claimed. “In the post-mortem report the doctors disclosed the cause of death due to internal injuries in chest and spine. Moreover, Ritik did not have any external injury which is impossible if someone falls from the third floor. I visited the spot where he had fallen in the hostel and witnessed no sign of blood or any such marks there. I suspect my son was murdered,” Rajnish said while talking to TOI. Following his complaint on June 17, a case under Section 302 (punishment for murder) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) was filed at the Kurukshetra University (KU) police station. “We have registered a case on the statement of Ritik’s father and it is being investigated. Earlier, during the police enquiry, it emerged that he died after falling from the third floor of the hostel but now his father raised suspicions on boy’s death and the case is being investigated accordingly,” said a police officer. No power tariff hike in Chandigarh, says.description: CHANDIGARH: Providing major relief to the residents, the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) approved the electricity department’s petition, wherein they had not proposed any hike in power tariff for financial year 2019-20. As per the latest orders of the JERC, the new tariff will be applicable from June 1 and will remain valid till further orders from the commission. The electricity department in its power tariff petition submitted before the JERC had stated that there will be a surplus of Rs 18.65 crore for period between financial year 2017-18 to 2019-20, therefore the department did not propose any power tariff hike. Last time, the JERC had marginally increased rates in domestic and commercial categories and had reduced rates in the industrial category for the financial year 2018-19. In the domestic category, rate were increased from Rs 2.55 to Rs 2.75 in the slab of 0-150 units, while there was no change in the rate of Rs 4.80 in the slab of 151-400 unit. In the slab of above 400 units, the rate was increased from Rs 5 to Rs 5.20 per unit. Along the similar lines, a small increase in the commercial consumer category was also made. In the commercial category, there was no change in the rate of Rs 5 in the slab between 0-150 units, while in slab of 151-400, rate was increased from Rs 5.20 to Rs 5.30 per unit. In above 400 slab, rate was increased from Rs 5.45 to Rs 5.60 per unit. In the latest petition, the UT Electricity Department had also submitted that they had started a drive against defaulters. The department submitted that they had issued notices to defaulters and even disconnected power supply of major defaulters. As per the latest list, there are total 270 defaulters, who owe over Rs 10 crore to the electricity department. Out of the 270 defaulters, the department had disconnected connections of around 50% consumers while the remaining are tangled in dispute with the department. Punjab chief secretary reviews preparati.description: SULTANPUR LODHI: As he reviewed preparations being made for celebrating 550th anniversary of Guru Nanak in this historic town, Punjab chief secretary Karan Avtar made it clear to the officials that all the ongoing works must be completed before September 30 this year. Chairing a meeting to review the preparations of the mega event here at office of the market committee, the chief secretary, accompanied by Commissioner Jalandhar division B Purusartha and Inspector General of Police Naunihal Singh said that the celebrations during the mega event would start from November 5 and holy city would witness huge rush of devotees till November 15, so all the ongoing development works needed to be completed before September end. He said that any sort of callousness in this task would not be tolerated at any cost. "The commemorative events must be a spectacular show for which every officer/ official must perform their duty zealously," he said. The chief secretary said that any sort of inordinate delay in execution of work was unwarranted and undesirable. He also said that besides ensuring prompt execution of work the officers must also make sure that the work was conducted as per the highest specifications of quality. In a big bonanza for the residents of Sultanpur Lodhi, he said that Bebe Nanaki Memorial University College for Girls would start professional courses like BCA/B Com from July 1 adding that this would provide an opportunity to girls of the region to have an access to quality education. The chief secretary also said that three tented cities to facilitate around 40,000 pilgrims would be erected at around 280 acres of land in Sultanpur Lodhi. Special arrangements would be made to ferry the pilgrims via rail and road route to Gurudwara Sahib, he said adding that fencing of Kali Bein would be done at two kilometres area which was vulnerable to avoid any sort of mishap. Chief secretary also said that a bio-diversity park would be set up on 8 acres of land as a part of the event adding that Nanak Bagichi would also come up in front of SDM office at Sultanpur Lodhi. He said that a hi-end light and sound show would be held at the holy city during the mega event. He also asked the various departments to ensure proper disposal of solid and liquid waste management during the celebrations. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Deputation of doctors failing to perform.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government has decided to cancel the deputation of doctors who fail to perform, especially in border areas. Health minister Balbir Singh Sidhu announced this on Wednesday, during a meeting with civil surgeons. Civil surgeons have been directed to ensure that senior medical officers, in their respective districts, visit sub-centres for ensuring effective implementation of public services. The minister said civil surgeons should ensure that doctors only prescribe medicines available in government hospitals, so that needy people do not have to buy medicines from private chemists at exorbitant prices. He was apprised by the civil surgeons posted in all districts regarding vacancies in medical staff cadre and sought details of all vacant posts in a week. To improve the performance of hospitals and streamline their functioning, 535 nurses have been recruited under the National Health Mission last month and another 114 will be recruited by the last week of June, said Sidhu. Reviewing health and wellness centres established to provide 13 essential health services, Sidhu said till August 2019, 553 community health officers would be appointed at health and wellness centres and 1,800 sub-centres would be turned into wellness centres. In all, 847 centres have been made functional with 419 community health officers being appointed for the purpose. He said computers would also be provided to community health officers for digitalizing the details of patients. Punjab additional chief secretary (health and family welfare) Satish Chandra brought to the notice of the minister that Punjab and Andhra Pradesh had been adjudged as the better performing states on parameters of establishing health and wellness centres. Exam for post of naib tehsildar: HC lens.description: CHANDIGARH: Taking cognizance of a plea seeking cancellation of the written examination recently conducted by the Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) for recruitment on naib tehsildar’s post, the Punjab and Haryana high court has fixed July 8 for hearing the petition The matter came under HC scanner after Bhiwani resident Devender Singh and seven other candidates who took the exam, filed a petition, seeking re-examination. Their contention is that despite the arrest of several persons for allegedly leaking the question paper for selection of naib tehsildars, the commission has not cancelled the examination. The petitioner informed the HC that the exam papers were leaked in Karnal and police were able to nab a whole gang of persons who were involved in supplying the same to a large number of candidates. “When the paper was leaked, then the sanctity of the test was itself lost and the HPSC should have cancelled the same and ordered re-examination. It was just one gang that was caught. What about the other or others who were not caught or detected and the persons to whom it was further circulated, as today just a click of button on phone sends the same to thousands,” the petitioners’ counsel Saurabh Dalal submitted to the HC. Dalal also contended that the state machinery and the HPSC were not capable of handling and conducting the exam and even if a single candidate got the answer key to the leaked paper, the future of thousands of other candidates would be at stake on account of unfair means by some. He also submitted that the state and the HPSC should employ fool-proof measures of conducting examinations so that the future of those who have put in years of hard work and dedication is not jeopardized. The petitioners have prayed for cancellation of the examination held on May 26 and re-conduct of the written examination. In July 2015 and May 2018, the HPSC had issued advertisement for the selection of 70 posts of naib tehsildar (Group-B) in revenue and disaster management department, Haryana. The commission conducted the written exam in various districts of Haryana on May 26. The Haryana Police claim to have busted a gang allegedly involved in leaking the examination paper at Rewari on May 26. The paper leak was cracked by Rewari Police and the special task force (STF), Gurgaon, on the basis of secret information. According to preliminary investigation, the paper was leaked in Karnal and solved in Gurgaon. The answer keys were to be provided to candidates in Rewari centre but the accused were nabbed before that. The HPSC declared the result of the written examination on June 13. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
